==Events==
* [[960]] &ndash; [[Battle of Andrassos]]: [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantines]] under [[Leo Phokas the Younger]] score a crushing victory over the [[Hamdanid]] [[Emir of Aleppo]], [[Sayf al-Dawla]].
*[[1278]] &ndash; [[Trần Thánh Tông]], the second emperor of the [[Trần dynasty]], decides to pass the throne to his crown prince [[Trần Khâm]] and take up the post of [[:vi:Thái thượng hoàng|Retired Emperor]].
*[[1519]] &ndash; [[Hernán Cortés]] enters [[Tenochtitlán]] and [[Aztec]] ruler [[Moctezuma II|Moctezuma]] welcomes him with a great celebration. 
*[[1520]] &ndash; [[Stockholm Bloodbath]] begins: A successful invasion of Sweden by Danish forces results in the execution of around 100 people.
*[[1576]] &ndash; [[Eighty Years' War]]: [[Pacification of Ghent]] &ndash; The [[States General of the Netherlands]] meet and unite to oppose Spanish occupation.
*[[1602]] &ndash; The [[Bodleian Library]] at the [[University of Oxford]] is opened to the public.
*[[1605]] &ndash; [[Robert Catesby]], ringleader of the [[Gunpowder Plot]]ters, is killed.
*[[1614]] &ndash; Japanese [[daimyo]] [[Dom Justo Takayama]] is exiled to the Philippines by shogun [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]] for being Christian.
*[[1620]] &ndash; The [[Battle of White Mountain]] takes place near [[Prague]], ending in a decisive [[Catholic]] victory in only two hours.
*[[1644]] &ndash; The [[Shunzhi Emperor]], the third emperor of the [[Qing dynasty]], is enthroned in Beijing after the collapse of the [[Ming dynasty]] as the first Qing emperor to rule over China.
*[[1745]] &ndash; [[Charles Edward Stuart]] invades England with an army of ~5000 that would later participate in the [[Battle of Culloden]].
*[[1837]] &ndash; [[Mary Lyon]] founds Mount Holyoke Female Seminary, which later becomes [[Mount Holyoke College]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The "[[Trent Affair]]" &ndash; The {{USS|San Jacinto|1850|6}} stops the British mail ship ''Trent'' and arrests two [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] envoys, sparking a diplomatic crisis between the UK and US.
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[Montana]] is admitted as the 41st [[U.S. state]].
*[[1892]] &ndash; The [[1892 New Orleans general strike|New Orleans general strike]] begins, uniting [[African American|black]] and [[White people|white]] American [[trade union]]ists in a successful four-day general [[strike action]] for the first time.
*[[1895]] &ndash; While experimenting with electricity, [[Wilhelm Röntgen]] discovers the [[X-ray]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; The [[Wilmington Insurrection of 1898]], the only instance of an attempted [[coup d'état]] in American history.
*[[1901]] &ndash; Bloody clashes take place in [[Athens]] following the translation of the [[Gospels]] into [[demotic Greek]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; The People's Commissars give authority to [[Vladimir Lenin]], [[Leon Trotsky]], and [[Joseph Stalin]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Beer Hall Putsch]]: In [[Munich]], [[Adolf Hitler]] leads the [[Nazism|Nazis]] in an unsuccessful attempt to overthrow the German government.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Great Depression]]: [[New Deal]] &ndash; US President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] unveils the [[Civil Works Administration]], an organization designed to create jobs for more than 4 million unemployed. 
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Spanish Civil War]]: [[Francoist Spain|Francoist]] troops fail in their effort to capture [[Madrid]], but begin the 3-year [[Siege of Madrid]] afterwards.
*[[1937]] &ndash; The [[Nazism|Nazi]] exhibition ''[[The Eternal Jew (art exhibition)|Der ewige Jude]]'' ("The Eternal Jew") opens in [[Munich]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Venlo Incident]]: Two British agents of [[Secret Intelligence Service|SIS]] are captured by the Germans.
*  1939   &ndash; In [[Munich]], [[Adolf Hitler]] narrowly escapes the assassination attempt of [[Georg Elser]] while celebrating the 16th anniversary of the [[Beer Hall Putsch]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Greco-Italian War]]: The Italian invasion of Greece fails as outnumbered Greek units repulse the Italians in the [[Battle of Elaia–Kalamas]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Operation Torch]] &ndash; United States and United Kingdom forces land in [[French North Africa]].
*  1942   &ndash; World War II: French resistance coup in Algiers, in which 400 civilian French patriots neutralize Vichyist XIXth Army Corps after 15 hours of fighting, and arrest several Vichyst generals, allowing the immediate success of [[Operation Torch]] in Algiers.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: [[United States Air Force]] Lt. Russell J. Brown, while piloting an [[F-80 Shooting Star]], shoots down two [[North Korea]]n [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-15|MiG-15]]s in the first [[jet aircraft]]-to-jet aircraft [[dogfight]] in history.
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Operation Grapple#Grapple X|Operation Grapple X, Round C1]]: the United Kingdom conducts its first successful [[hydrogen bomb]] test over [[Kiritimati]] in the Pacific. 
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[John F. Kennedy]] defeats [[Richard Nixon]] in one of the [[United States presidential election, 1960|closest presidential elections]] of the twentieth century to become the 35th president of the United States.
*[[1965]] &ndash; The [[British Indian Ocean Territory]] is created, consisting of [[Chagos Archipelago]], [[Aldabra]], [[Farquhar Group|Farquhar]] and [[Des Roches]] islands.
*  1965   &ndash; The [[Murder (Abolition of Death Penalty) Act 1965]] is given Royal Assent, formally abolishing the [[death penalty]] in the United Kingdom.
*  1965   &ndash; The [[173rd Airborne]] is ambushed by over 1,200 [[Viet Cong]] in [[Operation Hump]] during the [[Vietnam War]], while the [[1st Battalion, Royal Australian Regiment]] fight one of the first set-piece engagements of the war between Australian forces and the Viet Cong at the [[Battle of Gang Toi]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; Former [[Massachusetts]] Attorney General [[Edward Brooke]] becomes the first [[African American]] elected to the [[United States Senate]] since [[Reconstruction Era|Reconstruction]].
*  1966   &ndash; U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] signs into law an [[antitrust]] exemption allowing the [[National Football League]] to merge with the upstart [[American Football League]]. 
*[[1968]] &ndash; The [[Vienna Convention on Road Traffic]] is signed to facilitate international road traffic and to increase road safety by standardising the uniform traffic rules among the signatories.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[HBO]] launches its programming, with the broadcast of the 1971 movie ''[[Sometimes a Great Notion (film)|Sometimes a Great Notion]]'', starring [[Paul Newman]] and [[Henry Fonda]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; The right ear of [[John Paul Getty III]] is delivered to a newspaper together with a ransom note, convincing his father to pay US$2.9 million.
*[[1976]] &ndash; A series of earthquakes spreads panic in the city of [[Thessaloniki]], which is evacuated.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Manolis Andronikos]], a Greek archaeologist and professor at the [[Aristotle University of Thessaloniki]], discovers the tomb of [[Philip II of Macedon]] at [[Vergina]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Remembrance Day bombing]]: A [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|Provisional IRA]] bomb explodes in [[Enniskillen]], [[Northern Ireland]] during a ceremony honouring those who had died in wars involving British forces. Twelve people are killed and sixty-three wounded.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Iraq disarmament crisis]]: [[UN Security Council Resolution 1441]] &ndash; The [[United Nations Security Council]] unanimously approves a resolution on [[Iraq]], forcing [[Saddam Hussein]] to [[disarmament|disarm]] or face "serious consequences".
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[2003 invasion of Iraq|War in Iraq]]: More than 10,000 U.S. troops and a small number of [[Iraq]]i army units participate in a siege on the insurgent stronghold of [[Fallujah]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; The [[potentially hazardous asteroid]] [[2005 YU55]] passes 0.85 [[lunar distance (astronomy)|lunar distance]]s from Earth (about {{convert|324600|km|disp=or}}), the closest known approach by an asteroid of its [[Absolute magnitude#Solar system|brightness]] since {{mpl|2010 XC|15}} in 1976.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Typhoon Haiyan]], one of the [[List of tropical cyclone records|strongest storms]] in history hits the [[Visayas]] region in the [[Philippines]]. The typhoon killed 6,201 people as of 29 January 2014 and was considered the deadliest [[Typhoons in the Philippines|typhoon]] to hit the country. It caused around $1 billion in damages unofficially.
